intro: Ammannia hockii, commonly known as the redroot ammannia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. Ammannia hockii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
